intro: Cordylanthus brunneus, commonly known as the brown curlcup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are small, clustered, and often have a pale yellow to brownish hue. Cordylanthus brunneus plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological studies due to its resilience in challenging environments.
